duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain fleet records on inventory levels, preventive maintenance schedules, and corrective maintenance performed on all units.
Input fleet information into the computerized fleet management system daily.
Act as a point of contact with vendors to order, receive and ensure payment for goods and services.
Prepare truck purchase orders for management approval, including assignment of general ledger codes.
Receive, tag, stock and dispense parts to mechanics according to Corporate and Regional policy and local operating procedures.
Review purchase orders with accounting to ensure accuracy and proper payment of invoices.
Produce various productivity and usage reports for management review.
Follow all safety policies and procedures to achieve safety goals.
Reconcile Dossier financial data to Lawson general ledger.
Support the Fleet Manager with analysis of fleet operations reports.
Assist with parts organization and inventory.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: 1 year of general office experience or equivalent training.
